attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
dear prime minister, i petition this government to explain there right to choose who lives and dies all due to the expense of life saving cancer drugs, when they have just given the banks £37 billion pounds because banks got greedy, why should peoples lives be less valuable. as a widow of a liver cancer patient , to watch someones life disappear in 5mths , the cancer drugs should be in every hospital in this country. peoples lives can not be measured by money values at all, or is this government stating no-one in this country has the right to life if we become in with cancer?
when will peoples lives mean anything to your government.

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name.
reasons: The names of individuals, or information where they may be identified, in relation to criminal accusations
